review.author: Frontend
review.findings: UI capability gating reviewed across 4 files + 1 test file. (1) oracle.js: ipcRenderer.invoke('get-feature-capabilities') at line 130 matches ipcMain.handle at settings-handlers.js:42. ipcRenderer.on('feature-capabilities-updated') at line 135 matches webContents.send at settings-handlers.js:123. Payload consumption correct — reads imageGenAvailable (line 89) and recraftAvailable (line 103), both present in feature-capabilities.js return shape. Post-generation re-enable (line 192) uses cached imageGenAvailable — correct behavior if keys removed mid-generation. (2) renderer.js: Same IPC names at lines 1188/1196. Reads voiceTranscriptionAvailable (lines 1190/1198) — matches feature-capabilities.js shape. updateVoiceUI disable logic (line 789): !voiceEnabled || !voiceCapabilityAvailable — correct, disabled when EITHER condition fails. Title shows appropriate missing-key message. (3) oracle.css: 3 small rules (lines 241-252), uses existing CSS vars, no !important, --color-warning fallback. Matches existing naming conventions. (4) Tests: 12 tests across 2 describe blocks. Oracle tests (7) exercise real applyImageGenCapability with varying payloads — button disabled state, title, hint text, CSS classes, element reuse, null guard. Voice tests (5) verify boolean disable logic and tooltip strings — logic-only tests acceptable since voice button is in renderer closure. (5) Memory: Both oracle.js and renderer.js register feature-capabilities-updated listeners — intentional (different concerns). Registered once at init in single-page Electron app — no cleanup needed. (6) Cross-file: ipcRenderer import pattern in oracle.js consistent with rest of file. No issues found.

_docs.rule: If change_type !== 'routine', reviewer model MUST differ from author model
_docs.workflow: 1. Author fills author+author_model+change_type. 2. Reviewer fills reviewer+model+result+findings. 3. Pre-commit checks result=approved and cross-model rule. 4. After commit, review.json is reset to pending.
